testCase.name: exponetialPollingWithPromisePredicateFetch backoff behavior should increase delay costant after RETRY_NUMBERS_LINEAR attempts
exponetialPollingWithPromisePredicateFetch backoff behavior should increase delay exponentially after RETRY_NUMBERS_LINEAR attempts
ecommerceIOGetTransactionInfo returns Some(value) when client returns Right with status 200
ecommerceIOGetTransactionInfo returns None when client returns Right with non-200 status
ecommerceIOGetTransactionInfo returns None when client throws an error
ecommerceCHECKOUTGetTransaction returns Some(value) when client returns Right with status 200
ecommerceCHECKOUTGetTransaction returns None when client returns Right with non-200 status
ecommerceCHECKOUTGetTransaction returns None when client throws an error
decodeFinalStatusResult returns false when counter reaches retries
decodeFinalStatusResult returns true for non-200 status immediately
decodeFinalStatusResult returns false when 200 + interrupt
decodeFinalStatusResult returns true when 200 + no interrupt
clientWithPolling module creates IO client with polling
clientWithPolling module creates CHECKOUT v1 client with polling
clientWithPolling module creates CHECKOUT v2 client with polling
PaymentResponsePage redirects immediately to GENERIC_ERROR if no fragments
PaymentResponsePage calls IO-get + redirects to GENERIC_ERROR when API yields none
PaymentResponsePage on SUCCESS shows continue button only after the delay (IO)
PaymentResponsePage calls CHECKOUT-get + redirects to GENERIC_ERROR when API yields none (CHECKOUT)
PaymentResponsePage calls CHECKOUT-get + redirects to SUCCESS when API yields some (CHECKOUT)
